meanings.definition: A person who sells fruit and vegetables from a cart or stall.
meanings.sent1: The costermonger had a colorful cart full of fresh fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The costermonger set up his stall in the bustling market.
meanings.sent3: The costermonger joked with customers as he offered them his produce.
meanings.sent4: The costermonger's cart was a mobile garden of healthy treats.
meanings.sent5: Children loved to visit the costermonger to pick out their favorite fruits.

meanings.definition: To sell fruit and vegetables from a cart or stall.
meanings.sent1: She decided to costermonger her surplus harvest to earn some extra money.
meanings.sent2: During the fair, he would costermonger his homegrown tomatoes to the attendees.
meanings.sent3: The neighbors were surprised to see him costermongering his backyard produce.
meanings.sent4: In the old days, people would costermonger their goods in the town square.
meanings.sent5: The farmer costermongered his fresh apples with pride and enthusiasm.
